snippet: The effects of Sunday’s attack on civilians and the recent burning of Korans imperil President Obama’s plan to hand control to the Afghans while drawing the Taliban to talks.
abstract: News analysis; outrage from back-to-back episodes of the Koran burning and killing of at least 16 Afghan civilians imperils what the Obama administration once saw as an orderly plan for 2012: to speed the training of Afghan forces so that they can take control of combat missions, while drawing the Taliban into negotiations to end more than a decade of constant war.
lead_paragraph: The effects of Sunday’s attack on civilians and the recent burning of Korans imperil President Obama’s plan to hand control to the Afghans while drawing the Taliban to talks.

headline.seo: Attack May Derail Effort to Force Taliban Into Talks
headline.main: Attack May Derail Effort to Force Taliban Into Talks
headline.print_headline: In Assessing the Damage in Afghanistan, Fears of an Emboldened Taliban
